text:
Second Avenue, west side, from E. 38th (left) to 39th (right) Streets, as viewed northeastward from atop No. 301 E. 38th Street. Across the roofs of these structures are buildings in the Grand Central zone; prominent of which are the Chanin, the Commodore Hotel and the Grand Central Building (under construction). To the left of the first mentioned feature is the stack of the Hupfel Brewing Co. Note the lack of the subsequently erected Chrysler Building which if present would obscure the view of the hotel. In the lower foreground is a clearance on the east side of Second Avenue between 38th and 39th Streets and is not to be confused with a similar arrangement between 39th and 40th Street.

September 2, 1928.

P.L. Sperr

38th Street, north side, west from and including Second Avenue, showing the Hupfel Brewery at Nos. 235-225. There is a clearing on the N.E. corner of Second Avenue.
September 2, 1928.

P. L. Sperr.

300, 302-304 East 38th Street, at and adjoining the S.W. corner of Second Avenue, seen from the clearing on the N.W. corner. September 2, 1928.

P. L. Sperr.

38th Street, north side, east from 213 East, east of Third Avenue, to, but not including, Second Avenue. Notice the Hupfel brewery. September 17, 1930

P. L. Sperr.

Second Avenue, west side, north from E. 39th (lower left) to 42nd (upper right) Streets, as viewed northeastward from atop No. 301 E. 38th Street. The tenements shown occupy the 39th - 40th and 40th - 41st Street blocks. The white business structure seen is a portion of the News Building of which the southerly side (north side of 41st Street) predominates. Obstructing the store fronts is the Second Avenue "El".

View No. 2 shows only the 39th - 40th Street frontage, which No. 3, being from the street level shows the N.W. corner at 39th Street and the Avenue. Overhead in this instance are the Chanin and Chrysler Buildings.

September 11, 1931
Views 1 and 2
View 3: April 8, 1936.

P.L. Sperr

38th Street, north side, from Second Avenue towards Third, showing the old Hupfel Brewery at Nos. 235-225.
April 8, 1931.

P. L. Sperr.

General View Midtown Manhattan, East 40's: View 1 shows the Chrysler Building and portions of the Chanin (left) and News Buildings, seen across tenements from 38th Street near Second Avenue.
View 2 is northeastward from the Empire State Building across the 42nd Street district and on up toward and beyond the Queensboro Bridge and Welfare Island. In the center is the Chrysler Building and proceding it, the lower Chanin Building. To the left is the Rectangular-roofed Lincoln Building. In the left background is the white group of buildings--the New York Hospital. On the right of the view is the borough of Queens. View 3 is east along 42nd Street from near Broadway. The rear of the New York Public Library is in the center. The buildings from left to right are: Lefcourt National, 500 Fifth Avenue (under construction), Chrysler, Lincoln, Lefcourt-Colonial, 10 East 40th Street.
View 1: WPA Photo.  September, 1931
View 2.3: P. L. Sperr  View 2: Sept. 1931
View 3: July, 1930
title: General view - Midtown Manhattan - East 40s.

text:
E. 38th Street, west from Second Avenue.  The Stuyvesant Thrift Shop at the left bears No. 702 Second Avenue.  To the right appear a partial view of Hupfel's Brewery.
January 17, 1939
Somach Photo Service
New York City Tunnel Authority

E. 38th Street, west from Second Avenue, showing mainly the north side of this thoroughfare. The prominent structure is the J. C. G. Hupfel Brewery. Note the shadowy outline of the office building No. 10 E. 40th Street, to the left of same.

January 7, 1939

Somach Photo Service
New York City Tunnel Authority

E. 38th Street, south side, east from Second Avenue.

January 7, 1939

Somach Photo Service
New York City Tunnel Authority

E. 38th Street, south side, east from (No. 306, right) a point east of Second Avenue and towards the East River. The easterly half of this block will be demolished in the Fall of 1936.

January 7, 1939

Somach Photo Service
New York City Tunnel Authority

E. 38th Street, north side, east from (No. 307-313 garage left) a point to the east of Second Avenue, to the East River (right). To the right and on opposite sides of First Avenue are the Eletco Co. warehouse (erected Fall 1928) and the Consolidated Edison Co. power house. The latter is east of First Avenue and extends to the river.

January 7, 1939

Somach Photo Service
New York City Tunnel Authority

E. 38th Street, south side, west from (No 214, left) a point between Second and Third Avenues and to the latter.

January 7, 1939

Somach Photo Service
New York Tunnel Authority

E. 38th Street, south side, east from (No. 214, right) a point between Third and Second Avenues and towards the latter.
January 7, 1939
Somach Photo Service
New York City Tunnel Authority

E. 38th Street, north side, west from (No. 223, right) a point between Second and Third Avenues and across the latter.

January 7, 1939

Sømach photo Service
New York City Tunnel Authority

214 E. 38th Street, south side, between Second and Third Avenues, showing a 5 story tenement to the rear of the Jarcho Building (No. 213-17 E. 37th Street), both of which are to be demolished, cutting a swath thru this block. To the left is the Hupfel Garage (No. 216-218) and which may be included with the tenement on the right (No. 210 E.).

January 17, 1939

Somach Photo Service
New York City Tunnel Authority

Second Avenue and E. 38th Street, s.e. cor.
P. L. Sperr, photographer
July 5, 1940
